page.title: 02A POPULATION SURVEY
page.content: As the population has increased greatly in the last 15 years we decided to do a survey,using the 500 children and their parents in our school,to see where they were born.We found that 151 of the children were born in Cranleigh or the villages nearby.Very few of their parents were born in Cranleigh though.187 were born in Surrey but 92 were born in Greater London,49 in the Midlands 43 in North West England. We wondered whether parents worked in Cranleigh but after surveying we found that most fathers worked in London. Over 100 worked in other parts of Surrey. Only 44 worked in Cranleigh and 39 in Guildford. Most of the mothers worked locally. We think this is because they often work part-time and want to be near when their children finish school.
